page.title: 05Attleborough Bypass
page.content:
The bypass was opened on May 16th 1985 by Mrs Chalker, Minister for Transport, and Mr John Alston, Norfolk County Council leader. It took nine months to construct and was built to relieve congestion in Attleborough. The connecting roads from Morley are the old A11 and Silver Street. There were doubts about its safety, and on June 4th 1985 there was an accident between a coach and a lorry in which four people died and many were injured. One garage and a public house in Morley have been closed since trade has been diverted away.
SC21CS
